clinical_study.brief_title: Utility Study in Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL)
clinical_study.official_title: UK Utility Study in Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective, cross-sectional survey to be administered to real patients in remission from DLBCL using a 15-minute postal or online survey. The project is designed to describe the impact of DLBCL remission on health utility and quality of life. Data collection will occur over a 4-month period.

primary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life According to European Quality of Life 5-Dimension 5-Level (EQ-5D-5L) Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 months of data collection

arm_group.description: A cohort of approximately 100 patients in first remission with DLBCL will complete questionnaires through a 15-minute postal or online survey.

study_pop.textblock: Approximately 100 patients in first remission with DLBCL will be recruited from online advertisements and a specialist medical recruitment agency to complete study-administered questionnaires.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults greater than or equal to (>/=) 18 years of age
- Diagnosis of DLBCL and currently in first remission
- Prior drug treatment for DLBCL
Exclusion Criteria:
- Receiving active treatment for DLBCL
- Relapsed following any treatment for DLBCL
